author: HersheyBearsHockey1938
title: Very nice battle pack, nice build
review: Alright, I know, coming from a 79 piece set, yeah there's not much to build. What's included for what you pay for, is. First, though, is the focus of the battle pack concept: minifigures. Compared to the most recent edition of a Rebel based battle pack from 2008, this one shakes it up. New torsos and helmets, along with the new-concept visors and new faces give the Rebels some variety, and the thing that really sold it to me: Zev Senesca. Sure, a named pilot who actually never fought on the ground in the battle (he was shot down), but what I'm really looking at is the make of him. LEGO decided to update the Rebel Pilot, obviously with goggles and a new helmet, but a double sided torso that features much, much accurate details. The sole vehicle of the set makes up the rest of the build, officially an Ice Cutter from deleted scenes in Episode V, features 2 rockets and a pair of cannons plus a command chair. The thing is actually a pretty nice sized build compared the the already seen speeder bike (which is just 7676 and 8038's in white form) and a little command center. Pick up the set, it's worth every penny!

author: vwong19
title: Reinforcements for the Rebels
review:
Let's face it, when you buy this set it's all about getting more Rebel minifigs for the Empire Strikes Hoth battle.

The set is priced normally at $11 (TRU jacks up the prices).... inflation.

Pros: 
- New torsos that match other rebel solders
- New helmets
- Another pilot to the fleet

Con:
- Eyes are different from previous Star War generics. Simple smiley faces are apparently a thing of the past. Rebel officer is kinda scary.
- Price/brick ratio

Overall it's a win. The new faces are not as bad as the clone war faces.

author: yodaccm
title: Only thing that holds it back is the absurd cost...
review:
*Sigh*  I picked this up at TRU for $15.  Along with this set, I saw the TIE Defender and Freeco speeder, so go grab them just in time for the Christmas holiday!  

I suppose there is no point to continue to complain about the cost of Star Wars Legos, so I'll just ask why this set is $15 when the previous battle packs were $10?

Anyway, the new figures are great, I have to admit.  The updated Hoth troopers are nicely detailed with new helmets, torsos and visors.  The new helmets lack the ability to flip the visor up and down, but that is a small issue.  These new guys make their predecessors look ill-equipped for the harsh Hoth environment.  You also have a new Rebel commander, complete with authoritative mustache.  The biggest draw to me was Zev Senesca, a new Rebel pilot.  Like previous reviews have said, Zev has an updated look with more detailed jumpsuit and helmet.

The little vehicle is what you would expect, not bad but not great.  Overall, a wonderful addition to the ever expanding Hoth sub-theme Lego seems to crank out every now again.  Grab a few as this will most likely be the cheapest set this season.

author: Niallskie
title: Patience is a virtue
review:
I saw a bunch of these at our local TRU, but man you would not believe how they jacked up the price to $16.99. I was really tempted to buy it then coz I want to have it on the spot, but common sense got the best of me and told myself if I wait long enough this set will eventually come out on its regular price (which I thought would be $14.99). Hold and behold, went to Target and there it was, a whole lot of then for just $10.99. Grab a bunch of then as well as the 8084 set. I could not believe that TRU would jack it that high.

  Anyways, on to the review. This set is definitely a must have to enlarge your rebel forces. There aer also a bunch of new stuff that a SW Lego collector would appreciate like Zev's face print, loved the build in visor but would have been better if the visor is attachable to the helmet itself. I also think the torso print is new, specially the hose thing that sways to the right side. Head gear for the Rebel Trooper are cool in its design, visors might not be able to come up and down but you can clip it either on the top or right in the eyes, either which way you want to go. I also like the light brown pants for the Troopers, a nice change from the usual grey crotch and white legs. Torso design is awesome too, belt addition is a great improvement. Ice Cutter vehicle is a simple but very solid build, drop it as much as you want and it still hold firm. Torret are cool as well, same goes for the flick missiles. Another simple design but quite ingenious is the gun holder on the side of the Ice Cutter driver. I could not remember if it was in the instruction but I just saw it in the picture above and realized it. One question though is what's the use of the removable box in the middle of the Ice Cutter, gun holder, compartment, I don't know? 

  Other than that everything is for you to decide if you like this set or not, but to me this is a great set specially if you get it for the right price.

author: arctrooper170
title: Empire, Watch OUT!
review: "This is a pretty sweet set in terms of Battle packs. Yes I liked the old clone and droid ones and liked the old stormtrooper and rebel ones but the new versions all outmatch the old ones and this set is no exception. The Ice Cutter from Episode 5's deleted scenes was a perfect pick for this battle pack. Not huge but enough to take down some Empire Stormtroopers and Snowtroopers. I love the new Rebels with the interchangable visor helmets make the rebels more realistic. The Ice Cutter also has storage space for long distance trips which is a plus in my book. A awesome set."

author: THX_1138
title: Okay, but not great
review:
This set is pretty good, but it is not the best battle pack.

Pros:
-New torso for the pilot.
-New torso for some of the soldiers.
-We still get one of the older torsos on one soldier.
-New helmet print for Zev Senesca.
-The helmets on the soldiers are better colors and (in some ways) a more accurate shape.
-One or two of these vehicles would fit in well with the other Hoth rebel sets.
-Despite not being all that good, the vehicle is actually a real (although obscure) SW vehicle: http://starwars.wikia.com/wiki/Laser_ice-cutter
-Some good parts in the vehicle.

Cons:
-The vehicle is rather boring, and an Atgar 1.4 FD P-Tower (http://starwars.wikia.com/wiki/Atgar_1.4_FD_P-Tower) should have been put in this instead, along with maybe a tauntaun.
-The new helmets are very oversized, and look rather ridiculous. The old ones were just fine.

This set is okay. The minifigs (and maybe the parts) are the only reason to get it, and they aren't perfect.

author: captain_radda_radda
title: Good, but not worth $11
review:
I'll just come right out with it, this thing is a rip-off. Seriously, $11 dollars for something as big as a computer mouse! Come on, they could have at least included a turret dish or something. Other than that, this set is decent if nothing else. The Ice Cutter is quite movie accurate(even though it was only in there for 2 seconds) and is a nice rebel vehicle. The new rebels are really well built and the new hats are a nice touch. The pilot torso is detailed, but the white vest area is somewhat faded on my figure. 

Pros:
Mini figures are great
Finally, a decent rebel ground vehicle

Cons:
Too small
Brown Legs?! In the Snow?! 
Random crate in the middle
Too small
Price

Overall
A decent battle pack that goes great with the hoth rebel base and brings the hoth battle to the ground. I recomend it, but don't expect too much out of it.

author: Brickman193
title: "Walkers Inbound"
review:
At long last, LEGO Star Wars delivers a Hoth Rebel that is reasonably accurate to the film. A great set, and also agruably the best BP to date - it's even worth the $23 AUD price tag.

MINIFIGS
The set builds on the BP theme of having 1 command minifig (a grumpy looking mustachioed veteran that I call "Sarge"), two normal soldiers and a brand new Rebel pilot named Zev Senesca. All minifigs here are wonderful; the new hats are excellent, and the dour expressions on everyone's faces really give the impression that these guys are the first line of defence against the Imperial forces. The redesigned pilot, with brand new helmet and double sided torso is the star here. 5/5

SPEEDER
Apparently called an "ice cutter", this speeder is small, compact and a capable challenge for an Imperial speederbike. It comes with flick-fire missiles, a revolving turret, a box for holding supplies and a place to store the rifle for the pilot. Easy to build, sturdy and well designed. 5/5

Well, that's pretty much it. A set worth buying, playing and displaying. A fine purchase and a great way to celebrate 30 years of the Empire Strikes Back.

This is a long overdued battle pack that the Hoth Rebel Troopers deserve, I remember that years before I need to get one single Hoth Rebel at more than 7 USD. This set provides a good chance to collect them.

And a few other nice things about this set:
(1) Individual faces for the rebels
(2) New Pilot in new design
(3) New Hoth Rebel uniform and Helmet

But the vehicle (ice cutter?) is lacking excitment, I feel that 8084 has more fun equipments than this one.

I have a pictorial review at: http://brickand.me/2010/01/13/FinallyALegoBattlePackForRebelTroopers.aspx and I am also preparing a MOC combining 8083 and 8084, which I think would synergize well

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";">One of the things Lego is really
doing right lately are the production of these Star Wars battle packs.<span style="">  </span>Ever since the inception back in 2007 I have
waited in earnest to see what the next year’s offerings would be and I have
seldom been disappointed.<span style="">  </span>This set is a
little on the borderline but a good one nonetheless.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";">I know Rebel Hoth troops are
nothing to get worked up over, but these are the best yet.<span style="">  </span>The original one in the 1999 7130 Snowspeeder
is definitely vintage.<span style="">  </span>It has that lock
of hair with the old school Lego smiley face and the typical Lego helmet/visor
combo along with the rifle w/scope.<span style="">  </span>We
had a slight redo with the 4500 Snowspeeder, more changes with the Rebel Hoth
Base, and getting closer with last year’s Echo Base.<span style="">  </span>These have a great look that is much more
movie realistic with their visors and headgear.<span style=""> 
</span>The backpacks are also a nice touch.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";">Instead of giving us just one
flavor, we get Major Derlin (a.k.a. Cliff Claven) with his cop mustache.<span style="">  </span>Sure you need troopers, but every trooper has
to have his commander.<span style="">  </span>Having Zev
Senesca (Rogue Two) is a welcome addition.<span style=""> 
</span>The figure is generic enough that he could be used as multiple Rebel
Pilots.<span style="">  </span>Also, props for him coming with
a pistol.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";">What really makes the set neat is
that it came out so soon after the Echo Base set.<span style="">  </span>I wish the Troopers matched, but I guess that’s
OK since they could be from different ‘platoons’ or something.<span style="">  </span>I had a nice Hoth Battle setup on my
bookshelf with the different Hoth sets that have come out over the years.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";">The biggest downer is the Rebel
Zamboni, er, speeder.<span style="">  </span>It’s not all that
bad, I guess<span style="">  </span>When you’re done with the pickup
hockey game, you need something to smooth out the ice, right?<span style="">  </span>This one just happens to come heavily armed
with two flick fires and a swivel-mounted laser cannon on top.<span style="">  </span>It’s pretty solid and isn’t going to fall
apart on you either.<span style="">  </span>One nice addition
is the 1x1 ‘headlight’ brick just in front of the seat that doubles as a mount
for the driver’s gun.<span style="">  </span>I do not
understand, though, the purpose of the 2x2 box that fits in the middle of the
fuselage.<span style="">  </span>Perhaps another throwback to
the early days of SW Lego when we got the Battle Droid Zamboni in the 7141
Naboo Starfigher.<span style="">  </span>My only other
complaint is the phony visor on Zev’s face.<span style=""> 
</span>I’d rather have a clipon visor in case I want to give him some hair
instead of using the helmet.<span style="">  </span>I don’t
know what else could have been done.<span style="">  </span>The
gun turret thing has been done a couple of times, though a larger ‘radar’ style
cannon could have been included instead.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";">The price per part ratio is about
13 cents.<span style="">  </span>Not too bad considering four
solid minifigs are included with unique headgear.<span style="">  </span>I’m not too fond of the price being upped by
$1 to $10.99, but everything has gone up in price lately so boo hoo to me.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";">As far as part diversity, there’s a
good amount but not a lot of individual pieces due to the size of the set.<span style="">  </span>A decent quantity of bricks, slopes, and
miscellaneous items.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";">I’d go out a grab at least one,
then wait until a sale pops up before filling out your army.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align: justify;"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";"><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";">Borrowing the rating method from fbtb.net...<br>
<br>
price/parts ratio - 6/10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Calibri","sans-serif";">part selection - 8/10<br>
minifigs - 8/10<br>
construction - 7/10<br>
design/sturdiness - 9/10<br>
comparison to film – N/A<br>
swoosh factor - 6/10<br>
reviewer's tilt - 9/10<br>
FINAL SCORE – 7.6/10 ==> 4 of 5<o:p></o:p></span></p>

author: Loganwan
title: Great Troopers for a Great Price
review:
This is a really good battle pack.  I think the figures in this pack are about the best there have been in any battle pack.  The hats they wear really make the characters.  Either visors up or down, the figures look good.

I am not familiar with the vehicle though I hear it is from a deleted scene or concept.  There are many good pieces that make the vehicle, so they can be used elsewhere if you do not want an army of these little tanks.  I am intrigued by the little box in the middle of the vehicle.  It has a SNOT plate under it so the box can be removed.  There is nothing that suggests what it could be used for.

Overall a great battle pack with a pilot and three troopers.  I will have to get me more of these before they are gone forever.

author: Genius
title: Aren't Pilots Supposed To Drive?
review: Very good value for money, my only complaint is that every one seems to us a Hoth Trooper for a piolt. People, come on, isn't a piolt supposed to drive?! Apart from that very good, good army builder, I remember the days were you was lucky to get a minifigure and a gun and 5 white bricks for £9.99 and it cost more back then, but Lego still excpected you to pay for it. Lego has become a little smarter I think.

author: ChrisBricks1138
title: Imperial Invaders Beware!
review:
As a whole, I've never seen or purchased a better LEGO set for £9.99. This battle pack is the best so far due to the great collection of minifigures included and the Ice Cutter vehicle itself. Though fairly small, both the figures and the vehicle are rich in detail. Here are this the lowdown:

Pros:  

  • Ice Cutter vehicle (first model from a deleted scene)
  • New Rebel Trooper bodies, helmets and faces (save for the officer's, which is from an Indy set)
  • A new Rebel pilot, Zev Senesca with new helmet printing and new double sided torso
  • Flick fire missiles that work reasonably well!
  • Storage container, useful for the extra pieces
  • Well designed seat that can accomodate a minifigure wearing a backpack
  • Hole to store drivers gun

Cons: 

  • No real controls for the driver (or am I just being nitpicky?)

All in all, this set is probably going on my top ten sets list, because LEGO have pulled off a brilliant achievment by designing a vehicle from a deleted scene and capturing it perfectly. 10/10 all the way!

author: legophantom7
title: Best on yet!
review:
I have bought a lot of battle packs in the past and this one is by far the best one.  The minifigures are what make this set so great.  The new visors are amazing.  Lets go to the pros and cons 

Pros:

  • minifigs
  • 3 pistols 1 rifle
  • white visors
  • Ice cutter  
  • There is a crate in the middle of the ice cutter 
  • extra visor  
  • flick fire missles
  • no stickers!                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             

Cons:

  • The ice cutter is kind of blocky in the back

If you see this in the store you should get it.

author: legoDad42
title: Another Great Starter!
review:
Once again, Lego has put together a nice, simple Battle Pack to get your kid acclimated to the Lego world as well as a great army builder for the MOC'er out there. Comes with a Speeder(Laser Ice-Cutter), 3 Rebel soldiers and a Snowspeeder Pilot.

Good set to get a kid into Lego who's never built a kit before. Nice simple, easy build on the Speeder and the kid's will love the mini-figures. And of course for the AFoL and MOC builder looking to expand their collection of mini-figs.

Details...

Laser Ice-Cutter Speeder has 2 flick-fire missiles, twin cannons that rotate 360degree's(as well as tilt upwards), slot to hold blaster pistol and open storage container (removable) towards front (top) of vehicle.

Hoth Officer mini-fig with new headgear w/goggles, mustached face design and blaster pistol(note torso design is same as one from Echo Base 7749).

2 Hoth Rebel Troopers with new headgear w/goggles, blaster pistol and blaster rifle, and new torso print.

Zev Senesca Snowspeeder pilot with new helmet design, front variation design and back printed graphics plus a blaster pistol (first time I believe they put a character from the Star Wars films into a Battle Pack).

 

Pick this set up if you have a kid who wants to try Lego for the first time. Easy build and they'll love the speeder and mini-figs. Note that this is a sister set to the Snowtrooper Battle Pack 8084. Get both for great playability!

author: Roketah
title: No Bacta Tank
review:
Me and my cousin each had $20 to spend. I can't believe I picked this, when he got two Atlantis sets instead. Here are the Pros And Cons...

 

Pros

Spare Box

Main Gun Detaches Onto Stand

Officer

4 Guns

New Pilot

Gun Holder Near Seat

Cons

Small Tank

2 Identical Troops

Pilot Can't Use Gun Well

Flick Fire Missles

Should Have Made A Snow Speeder...

 

Good Set. Find It, Buy It...

author: ceroknight
title: Why does so many people think its a bad set?
review:
I havent really seen a bad lego starwars set. I have always seen decent or awesome sets. This set is in between.

Pros
  • 4 figs
  • nice design

author: EtudeTheBadger
title: 'There ain't enough life on this ice cube to fill a space cruiser!' - Han Solo
review:
I'll freely admit this now- I'm a Battle Pack addict. They're great for army building, spare parts, MOCs, etc.

Latest on LEGO's list is the Battle of Hoth- Battle Pack Style! In this pack, we have a Rebel commander with a broom of a 'tache, two youthful commandos and Zev Senesca, snowspeeder pilot tragically lost at the Battle of Hoth. Never saw that AT-AT coming... poor guy. Anyway, it's a great set. The figures are detailed brilliantly; so much effort has gone into making these guys look like Rebellion heroes from their kitbags and pouches to their tired yet motivated expressions. The tank included with the set is also cool; kind of resembles the T2-B tanks from Empire At War; great for a battle or two! I also like the flick-fire missiles used as a turret gun - all they're good for, really! The set is also rife with great parts- I never got a grey chair before... Finally, the flick-fire missiles in this set work! They actually WORK! Who'd have thought it?!

It's a Battle Pack, so of course there will be some drawbacks. First off, I noticed that the Zev Senesca face is the same one as those used for the Clone Pilots in the 2010 ARC-170. LEGO could have come up with a more original face. Furthermore, the price is a bit steep. £9.99? Heck, a couple of years ago this thing would've been a fiver. Finally, flick-fire missiles on the sides of the tank. They could go further, but now I'm being nitpicky.

It's a great Battle Pack, no doubts. The price is a bit... whoa, so try to get it at half price if you can! I'm looking for the Imperial Battle Pack now!

-maaboo35

author: Firox_5000
title: The rebe; have returned
review:
This is the smallest of the 2010 star wars sets.

 

The battle pack includes four rebel troopers one who is wearing a orange pilot fightng suit. The others are wearing more snow prepared gear.  The set also includes a small ground moving tank which has a rotating turret on top. 

 

The set is small but quite good value for £10. The set's playability is quite short alone  so I recomend getting the snowtrooper battle pack along with it.

 

Very good battle pack worth the money.

author: live2servehm
title: Beware Emipire
review:
This is an o.k. set. It's not the best set in the world but good.

The Mini-figs
I was very upset when i put the mini-figs together. the goggles are huge and look really dumb when you put them down. the helmets are new and i don't really like them. they should have stuck with the old ones. the Rebel pilot is one of the best parts of this set. he has goggles imprinted on his face and i think that they did a fantastic job on him.

The Ship Thingy

This is kinda pathetic. I think Lego was desperate and threw a bunch of pieces together. it looks really bulky when you put it together. the back is the best part of the ship. i was very pleased with the gun and how they slid the cargo box in there. i was bummed how there were no decals for it. it just looks kinda dull and boring.

Despite what i said it's an average set. It's good for the mini-figs and o.k. for the ship

author: Huge_Nerd
title: Good complemetary set to other Hoth sets
review:
This set is decent on it's own (if I had to choose one battle pack it would be the Imperial one), but goes really well with other sets. I put the pilot as the rear gunner aboard the snow speeder from the Wampa cave. I have the other two loose rebel troopers manning the turret and trench of Echo Base and the Laser cutter patrolling the area and fighting off wampa's, Imperials, etc.

 

Pros

  • nice new rebel soldiers with expressive faces and nice hats
  • guy with awesome moustache for 80s authenticity
  • the pilot is nice too if you have an extra seat in the cockpit of some flying vehicle or another
  • the laser-cutter is solid with a couple nice little features (nicely "articulate" turret, hover illusion, missiles)

Cons

  • The rebel figures are a little blah compared to the Imperials

author: Doctor_Leg_O_Brick
title: if you have got the snowtrooper battle pack...your in luck
review:
What a good battle pack. I must say, why so many reviews about its flaws, when i can only find one problem. To be honest, its only the book, one step is not problerly shown. On to the review.

 

THE BUILD

Not very long about 5-10 minutes, it depends how old you are.

 

THE PARTS

Some round parts that have lots of MOC possibility. Great idea having missle ends as guns/ice cutters. Finally lego have made a seat that you can seat a minifigure WITHOUT taking the back pack off!!GENIUS

 

THE PLAYABILITY

Great with the snowtrooper battle pack or other star wars sets. The four figures add lots of playability.

 

THE MINIFIGURES

You get zev sensca with blaster, 2 new rebels with new head gear and snow gear and 1 blaster and 1 rifle, and a rebel officer with blaster.

 

THE MONEY

Good for £10 plus, if you get ait cheaper then great.

 

THE OVERALL RATING

I'd give it a 5 bricks out of 5 bricks because whats not good about a battle pack??

author: Dark_raptor_88
title: Building Your army
review:
When I got this set on the way to my nans after school I was happy because I had'nt bought a lego set for a while but when I built it I was very dissopointed as I thought it would have more playability.If you were to buy this set you'd know what i mean.If you are a rebel fan this is a must have.

Pros

  • Buy enough and you'l have a rebel hoth trooper army.
  • 3 Rare'ish figures.

Cons

  • over priced 12:99 euros.
  • Very small.
  • Low playability.

Over all I give this set a 2/5

author: LegosetTV
title: Battle on Hoth
review:
This set is quite good. When I got it, I was so excited to build it! Though it only took me five minutes to build. But, it still was fun. My favorite minifigure would have to be Zev Senesca. I love his design, his double printed torso, and detail! If you're in the mood for a small LEGO Star Wars battlepack, this is the one to get! Now For the Pros and Cons.

 

Pros:

Good Minifigs!

Good Turret!

New Helmets!

Goggles On Helmets!

Big Seat For Minfigs with backpacks!

Flick-Fire Missiles!

A Place To Hold Driver's Gun!

 

Cons:

Big Gun Fits In Box, But Turret Does Not Move Well At All.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Stand Firm Men
review:
Set #8083 Rebel Trooper Battle Pack: A great new addition to my Hoth/Empire display.

 

The Rebel Trooper Battle Pack has a lot going for it, it includes a brand new headgear for the Hoth Rebels, my very first Rebel Pilot Mini-Figure Zev Senesca and the mustache sporting Hoth Rebel Commander from the trenches.

 

The Assault Vehicle, which looks kind of like a mobile miniature tank is a great looking little model, it is something I firmly believe that the Rebels could have employed during the battle of Hoth, what's more it doesn't have any sticker details. (I added a spare Rebel Shield Emblem from my Rebel Scout Speeder set to the sloped gray piece mainly because I wanted to get rid of the sticker sheet and had no use for keeping them lying around, but also because it adds a bit of detail to the model so you know who owns it.)

 

The Mini-Figures are all great, I really like that new Headgear piece and wish I could pick up a few spares through Pick-A-Brick so I can attach all those spare white visor pieces to something and have a few extra Hoth Rebel hats lying around in case I'm feeling quirky and... for example... want to have some Space Police 3 Mini-Figures wear it while joining the Rebel forces on Hoth in their battle against the Empire.

 

I think I've covered those new blaster accessories enough times in other LEGO Star Wars set reviews. This being my first Rebel Pilot Mini-Figure I will however say I am extremely impressed by the torso print, the coloring and the headgear worn by them. It's just a shame that if you buy two or more of this set and the Hoth Wampa Cave you'll have an overabundance of Zev Senesca... Who the devil is Zev Senesca anyway? And why does he deserve to be in both this and the Hoth Wampa Cave set when that Snowspeeder pilot could have been... Oh I don't know... Hobbie or somebody.

 

Overall I'd say get this set, get two, but I'd stop with two because too many Zev's and too many mustache sporting Hoth Rebel Commanders amongst your troops would just look a tad silly. (Unless you wanted to make up a new Hoth Rebel Commander and swap a different pink skinned head for his, I suppose then you'd have a good enough reason to pick up a few more.)

author: Holton
title: How many Zev's does a man need...
review:
I usually prefer to buy Imperial sets but I am looking to build up a Hoth collection and so I bought this along with the Hoth Wampa Cave (8089).

Box/Instructions

Great box with very clear images of the contents.  However, why are there clone troopers on my Classic Star Wars set?

Nothing much to say about the instructions.  They were very clear and had a lot of preview pages of other sets at the back which I like.

Parts

Again, nothing too special - mostly white with some different greys.  The white ridged 1x2 blocks and the white smooth circular pieces are interesting, however.

Minifigures

The real reason to buy this set!

The two rebel troopers and the Hoth officer are great.  The print on the torso and the new helmets with goggles are great (much more movie accurate).  I also think the goggles look quite good when placed down on the face as well.  I do like that backpacks were included for all three of them.

Zev Senesca is also a great minifigure.  He has an excellent rebel pilot torso, with detailed printing on both the front and back.  His helmet also has some great (movie-accurate) printed detail.  I was also impressed with the use of the clone pilot head piece to represent the classic orange goggles.  (More on him, though, in my summary).

The build

The vehicle is a very simple build and only took me about twenty minutes in total (with various pauses to play with the minifigures).  I cannot imagine anyone except the very youngest having any trouble.  That said, I am a fan of sticking bricks together so I personally enjoyed that twenty minutes.

The completed model

I was happy to learn the vehicle was actually from the movie (thanks to all those below who pointed that out) but it is not exactly a great representation mostly because of the flick-fire missiles.  I appreciate, though, that they do add to the playability.  It is actually very sturdy and I was particularly happy with the way it glides across surfaces thanks to the inclusion of those smooth, circular pieces on the bottom.

My only real problem with the vehicle was the seating arrangement.  It is just a 2x7 block extending from the back with a seat placed on it and, frankly, looks unfinished.  Some detailing on the bottom and/or sides would have helped make it look a lot more attractive.

Summary

Well, so far I have limited myself to just talking about the set as it stands individually.  There is not much playability individually, but it really is a partner to the Snowtrooper Battle Pack (8084).  However, the minifigures are well done and the vehicle is solid, if not particularly exciting.  In fact, having a couple of these vehicles placed around any of the Hoth base sets (7666, 7749 or the new 7879) would definitely add to the 'atmosphere'.

That said, this is essentially an army builder and even if you only wanted to buy one of this set, many who buy this will want to buy the Hoth Wampa Cave (8089) as well.  So I do not understand why there is a named character here.  I am sure for many one rebel pilot looks much like another but I am not happy having two Zev Senescas sitting in my snowspeeder.  The fact that the minifigure is movie-accurate actually makes it worse.  They really should have included a nondescript and unnamed rebel pilot.

All in all, if having multiples of a named (bit-part) character with no variations does not bother you or you only intend to buy just this one rebel Hoth set, it is a good buy.  In my opinion though, as a battle pack, it just does not work.
